Title: date + integer
Description: Add a number of days to a date
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date + interval
Description: Add an interval to a date
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date + time
Description: Add a time-of-day to a date
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: interval + interval
Description: Add intervals
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: timestamp + interval
Description: Add an interval to a timestamp
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: time + interval
Description: Add an interval to a time
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: - interval
Description: Negate an interval
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date - date
Description: Subtract dates, producing the number of days elapsed
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date - integer
Description: Subtract a number of days from a date
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date - interval
Description: Subtract an interval from a date
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: time - time
Description: Subtract times
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: time - interval
Description: Subtract an interval from a time
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: timestamp - interval
Description: Subtract an interval from a timestamp
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: interval - interval
Description: Subtract intervals
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: timestamp - timestamp
Description: Subtract timestamps (converting 24-hour intervals into days, similarly to justify_hours())
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: interval * double precision
Description: Multiply an interval by a scalar
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: interval / double precision
Description: Divide an interval by a scalar
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: timestamp without time zone AT TIME ZONE zone
Feature: timestamp without time zone AT TIME ZONE zone → timestamp with time zone
Description: Converts given time stamp without time zone to time stamp with time zone, assuming the given value is in the named time zone.
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: timestamp without time zone AT LOCAL
Feature: timestamp without time zone AT LOCAL → timestamp with time zone
Description: Converts given time stamp without time zone to time stamp with the session's TimeZone value as time zone.
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: timestamp with time zone AT TIME ZONE zone
Feature: timestamp with time zone AT TIME ZONE zone → timestamp without time zone
Description: Converts given time stamp with time zone to time stamp without time zone, as the time would appear in that zone.
Examples: timestamp with time zone '2001-02-16 20:38:40-05' at time zone 'America/Denver' → 2001-02-16 18:38:40
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: timestamp with time zone AT LOCAL
Feature: timestamp with time zone AT LOCAL → timestamp without time zone
Description: Converts given time stamp with time zone to time stamp without time zone, as the time would appear with the session's TimeZone value as time zone.
Examples: timestamp with time zone '2001-02-16 20:38:40-05' at local → 2001-02-16 18:38:40
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: time with time zone AT TIME ZONE zone
Feature: time with time zone AT TIME ZONE zone → time with time zone
Description: Converts given time with time zone to a new time zone. Since no date is supplied, this uses the currently active UTC offset for the named destination zone.
Examples: time with time zone '05:34:17-05' at time zone 'UTC' → 10:34:17+00
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: time with time zone AT LOCAL
Feature: time with time zone AT LOCAL → time with time zone
Description: Converts given time with time zone to a new time zone. Since no date is supplied, this uses the currently active UTC offset for the session's TimeZone value.
Assuming the session's TimeZone is set to UTC:
Examples: time with time zone '05:34:17-05' at local → 10:34:17+00
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators
